feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento deserialization vulnerability
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.3 and earlier, 2.2.10 and earlier, 1.14.4.3 and earlier, and 1.9.4.3 and earlier have a deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-3716
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-02.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9wc9-498w-h8xv

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Path Traversal
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.3 and earlier, 2.2.10 and earlier, 1.14.4.3 and earlier, and 1.9.4.3 and earlier have a path traversal vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to sensitive information disclosure.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-3717
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-02.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-874g-pxqp-frqp

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Path Traversal
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.3.3 and earlier, 2.2.10 and earlier, 1.14.4.3 and earlier, and 1.9.4.3 and earlier have a path traversal vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to sensitive information disclosure.

  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb20-02.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-874g-pxqp-frqp

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento remote code execution vulnerability
entry.content:
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with privileges to modify product catalogs can trigger PHP file inclusion through a crafted XML file that specifies product design update.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8154
  • https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4v2q-hjx3-c4vr

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento remote code execution vulnerability
entry.content:
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with privileges to modify product catalogs can trigger PHP file inclusion through a crafted XML file that specifies product design update.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8154
  • https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4v2q-hjx3-c4vr

entry.title: [studio-42/elfinder] elFinder Unrestricted File Upload vulnerability
entry.content:
A File Upload vulnerability exists in Studio-42 elFinder 2.0.4 to 2.1.59 via connector.minimal.php, which allows a remote malicious user to upload arbitrary files and execute PHP code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-43421
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/issues/3429
  • https://twitter.com/infosec_90/status/1455180286354919425
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/commit/c08bcbfa722d758d01975799b7036951eb5d33cb
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x4jx-hjwf-gc99

entry.title: [studio-42/elfinder] elFinder Path Traversal vulnerability
entry.content:
Studio 42 elFinder before 2.1.36 has a directory traversal vulnerability in elFinder.class.php with the zipdl() function that can allow a remote attacker to download files accessible by the web server process and delete files owned by the account running the web server process.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-9109
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/commit/157f471d7e48f190f74e66eb5bc73360b5352fd3
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/releases/tag/2.1.36
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/wiki/Advisory-about-vulnerability-of-CVE-2018-9109-and-CVE-2018-9110
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-45x3-mw7q-wf7f

entry.title: [studio-42/elfinder] elFinder Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
entry.content:
A Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in elFinder before 2.1.46 could allow a malicious user to access the content of internal network resources. This occurs in get_remote_contents() in php/elFinder.class.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-6257
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/commit/2f522db8f037a66ce9040ee0b216aa4a0359286c
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/blob/68ec63c0aeca3963101aca8f842dc9f2e4c4c6d3/Changelog
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3qhm-qfj3-4rrx

entry.title: [woocommerce/woocommerce] WooCommerce Incorrect Authorization
entry.content:
The WooCommerce plugin before 4.7.0 for WordPress allows remote attackers to view the status of arbitrary orders via the order_id parameter in a fetch_order_status action.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-29156
  • https://github.com/Ko-kn3t/CVE-2020-29156
  • https://raw.githubusercontent.com/woocommerce/woocommerce/master/changelog.txt
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wwh8-v3j3-gxfw

entry.title: [studio-42/elfinder] elFinder command injection vulnerability in the PHP connector
entry.content:
elFinder before 2.1.48 has a command injection vulnerability in the PHP connector.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-9194
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/blob/master/README.md
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/compare/6884c4f...0740028
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/releases/tag/2.1.48
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/46481/
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/46539/
  • https://github.com/Studio-42/elFinder/commit/374c88d7030eb92749267e17a4af21cc7520efa5
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4223-qj94-7x9p

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento OS Command Injection
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to OS command injection via the scheduled operation module. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution by an authenticated attacker. Access to the admin console is required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21018
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rv48-v862-mp92

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento OS Command Injection
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to OS command injection via the scheduled operation module. Successful exploitation could lead to arbitrary code execution by an authenticated attacker. Access to the admin console is required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21018
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rv48-v862-mp92

entry.title: [adodb/adodb-php] ADOdb Cross-site scripting vulnerability in old test script
entry.content:
Cross-site scripting vulnerability in ADOdb versions prior to 5.20.6 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-4855
  • https://github.com/ADOdb/ADOdb/issues/274
  • https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-59
  • http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN48237713/index.html
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/92753
  • https://github.com/ADOdb/ADOdb/commit/ecb93d8c1fd3bbde62aca9c3a13c32f077da2da8
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hhfw-xxhm-pf32

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Improper Access Control
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to an access control bypass vulnerability in the Login as Customer module. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21020
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2j6v-829g-885q

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Improper Access Control
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) are vulnerable to an access control bypass vulnerability in the Login as Customer module. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21020
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Insufficient Session Expiration
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) do not adequately invalidate user sessions. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources. Access to the admin console is not required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21031
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4h3p-63x6-vwg2

entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) do not adequately invalidate user sessions. Successful exploitation could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources. Access to the admin console is not required for successful exploitation.

  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Insufficient Session Expiration
entry.content:
Magento versions 2.4.1 (and earlier), 2.4.0-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.6 (and earlier) do not adequately invalidate user sessions. Successful exploitation of this issue could lead to unauthorized access to restricted resources. Access to the admin console is not required for successful exploitation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-21032
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb21-08.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4jfq-f8hc-775q
